# Government Tender Announcement
## Solicitation Number: 5P300-23-0173/A
### Title: Water Treatment Plant Operations and Maintenance / Fundy National Park
#### Solicitation Closing Date: 2023-11-16T14:00:00

### Summary
The Parks Canada Agency (PCA) is soliciting services for the operation of the water treatment plant and distribution systems at Fundy National Park. The contract will have a duration of two years with the option to extend for two additional one-year periods. Bidders are required to have a valid personnel security clearance and attend a mandatory site visit.

### Tender Information
* **EU Contract Notice ID:** None
* **Cancellation Date:** None
* **Empanelment Group:** None
* **TOV:** None
* **Tech Type:** None
* **ContraGuarantee:** None
* **Notice Type Description:** Request for Proposal
* **Government Entity/Local Authority:** Parks Canada Agency (PCA)

### Operational and Security Requirements
* Site visit is mandatory and will be held at 20 Service Road, Alma NB (At Fundy National Park Maintenance Compound) on November 9, 2023.
* Bidders must attend the site visit or send a representative to confirm attendance.
* New personnel security clearance requests will require mandatory fingerprints to initiate the criminal record check.

### Tender Submission Requirements
* Bidders are required to submit their proposals electronically via fax or email as indicated in the solicitation document.
* The maximum email file size that Parks Canada is capable of receiving is 15 megabytes.
* Bidders should be aware that emails with links to bid documents will not be accepted, and bid documents must be sent as email attachments.

### Mandatory Security Requirement
All personnel with access to the worksite will require a Personnel Security Clearance (PSC). bidders must ensure that they and their personnel have an existing or new PSC to have access to the worksite.

The bid documents can be downloaded from the Government Electronic Tendering Service (GETS) website at http://canadabuys.canada.ca/en/tender-opportunities. The Government of Canada reserves the right to negotiate with suppliers on any procurement. Twelve bidders attended the mandatory site visit to inspect the worksite.
